node.text: Welcome to our home, stranger! I'm Silvia and that grumpy man by the fireplace is my husband Herman. What brings you to our humble house?

option.optiontext: Don't mind me, I'm just an adventurer.
I should go.

node.text: Seeking adventure? In our home? Oh dear, I'm afraid we have very little of that to offer around here. How about some tea instead?

option.optiontext: Um, okay.
No time for tea, I must be going.

node.text: Oh splendid! Herman is a fine husband but he's not much of a talker so it can get pretty quiet around here, which is why I love having guests around.

option.optiontext: I'm always up for a chat.
To be fair, I'm more of a listener myself.
*Remain silent.*

node.text: Perfect! So what did you want to talk about?

option.optiontext: The young man outside by the forge, he's one of yours?
How's life here in Timberwell?
Is it normal for Herman to seem a bit agitated?

node.text: Aaron? Oh yes, he's a sweet boy, very handy around the forge. Not so much in other areas...

option.optiontext: How do you mean?

node.text: Oh, it's just a mother's concern, you know. It's time he found himself a decent woman, maybe built his own house and started his own family. But he's always been a shy, sensitive boy.

option.optiontext: Understandable, maybe he just needs time.
Indeed, the boy should learn how to be a real man!

node.text: Perhaps, but maybe he could be nudged a little? I've heard rumors that Grainwater has an abundance of dashing young maidens. Say, if you were traveling that way, could you make inquiries on Aaron's behalf - see if there was a suitable purehearted young lady available?

option.optiontext: Sure, I could do that.
What's wrong with the local women in Timberwell?
Where's Grainwater again?
I don't know if I feel comfortable with that.

node.text: That's what Herman always says... But maybe he could be nudged a little? I've heard rumors that Grainwater has an abundance of dashing young maidens. Say, if you were traveling that way, could you make inquiries on Aaron's behalf - see if there was a suitable purehearted young lady available?

option.optiontext: Sure, I could do that.
What's wrong with the local women in Timberwell?
Where's Grainwater again?
Aaron should man up and go there himself!

node.text: Oh, that would be wonderful! I'll be sure to offer you some sort of a finder's fee if you're able to send a suitable lady our way.

option.optiontext: Then I'll be going.

node.text: Have you spoken to any of them? Terrible hags the whole lot! Except for maybe Helga across the river, but I believe she prefers the company of other ladies if you catch my meaning.

option.optiontext: Sure, I could ask around in Grainwater.
Where's Grainwater again?
I don't know if I'm comfortable with this.

node.text: It's a quaint village southwest from here, by the waters of Aure near Haywind city. You can find it by following the road west toward Haywind from here, then continuing south where it forks.

option.optiontext: Sure, I could ask around in Grainwater.
What's wrong with the local women in Timberwell?
I don't know if I'm comfortable with this.

node.text: I understand but I'm desperate for my sensitive boy! Please won't you consider it? I'd be sure to offer you some sort of a finder's fee if you're able to send someone suitable our way.

option.optiontext: Fine, I'll ask around Grainwater if I end up going that way.
Wait, which way is Grainwater again?
Think this is something Aaron needs to figure out for himself. Good day to you.

node.text: Ugh... You sound just like Herman! Look, I'd be willing to offer you some sort of a finder's fee if you're able to send someone suitable our way.

option.optiontext: Well in that case! I'll ask around Grainwater if I end up going that way.
Wait, which way is Grainwater again?
No, I think this is something Aaron needs to figure out for himself.

node.text: It's a quaint village southwest from here, by the waters of Aure near Haywind city. You can find it by following the road west toward Haywind from here, then continuing south where it forks. Please, would you do this for my Aaron?

option.optiontext: Fine, I'll ask around Grainwater if I end up going that way.
No, I think this is something Aaron needs to figure out for himself. Good day to you.

node.text: Oh we love it! We were the first to settle here, you know. Away from the hustle and bustle of Haywind. Then all these other people decided to follow us here and now we're a whole village.

option.optiontext: The young man outside by the forge, he's one of yours?
Is it normal for Herman to seem a bit agitated?

node.text: Pff, don't mind him. He just gets cranky without his whiskey and it seems Master Barnsmill has had problems recently with supplying it.

option.optiontext: The young man outside by the forge, he's one of yours?
How's life here in Timberwell?

node.text: Oh that's fine, I could talk your ear off if you let me. Be it about my boy, or Herman, or just about regular olde Timberwell.

option.optiontext: The young man outside by the forge, he's one of yours?
How's life here in Timberwell?
Is it normal for Herman to seem a bit agitated?

node.text: Hm, perhaps you and Herman are something alike. But that's fine, usually I just complain to him about his grumbling, or our boy, or just about regular olde Timberwell.

option.optiontext: The young man outside by the forge, he's one of yours?
How's life here in Timberwell?
Is it normal for Herman to seem a bit agitated?

node.text: Oh, hello! I wasn't expecting to see you again. Do you think you could help my sensitive boy Aaron after all?

option.optiontext: Oh fine, I'll ask for potential brides around Grainwater for him.
Remind me, what was Aaron struggling with?
Just passing.

node.text: Oh that would be wonderful! I'll be sure to offer you some sort of a finder's fee if you're able to send someone suitable our way.

option.optiontext: I'll be going then.
Just which way is Grainwater again?

node.text: It's a quaint village southwest from here, by the waters of Aure near Haywind city. You can find it by following the road west toward Haywind from here, then continuing south where it forks.

option.optiontext: I'll be going then.

node.text: He's a good boy but Herman and I agree; it's time he found himself a decent woman, maybe built his own house and started his own family.
I've heard rumors that Grainwater has an abundance of dashing young maidens. Could you make inquiries on Aaron's behalf - see if there was a suitable purehearted young lady available?

option.optiontext: Fine, I could ask around.
What's wrong with the local women in Timberwell?
Where's Grainwater again?
No, I think this is something Aaron needs to figure out for himself.

node.text: Hello again! Have you been to Grainwater yet? Have you found potential brides for my special boy?

option.optiontext: Which way is Grainwater again?
Why aren't the local women of Timberwell good enough for him?
Not yet.

node.text: It's a quaint village southwest from here, by the waters of Aure near Haywind city. You can find it by following the road west toward Haywind from here, then continuing south where it forks.

option.optiontext: Why aren't the local women of Timberwell good enough for him?
I see.

node.text: Have you spoken to any of them? Terrible hags the whole lot! Except for maybe Helga across the river, but I believe she prefers the company of other ladies if you catch my meaning.

option.optiontext: Which way is Grainwater again?
I see.

node.text: There you are! And what a beautiful lady you found for my boy, oh this makes me so happy!

option.optiontext: How does Aaron feel about all this?
How does Aaron feel about all this?
How endearing. I believe I was promised payment?

node.text: Even he is completely enchanted by the woman you found! In fact, I believe he wanted to offer you something special as his thanks. But first, my payment to you as promised.

option.optiontext: My pleasure.

node.text: Oh, well, he's such a picky boy. He hasn't exactly been thrilled but I think he'll come around. Poor boy believes in some romantic notions of 'love' and such. Once he lets go of them, I'm sure he'll be happy.
Now, I believe you are due a reward for your troubles?

option.optiontext: It's been my pleasure.

node.text: Ahem, yes of course. A purse of gold coins for your efforts.

option.optiontext: My pleasure.

node.text: Oh, it's you... There's clearly been a terrible misunderstanding. Perhaps I should not have asked for your assistance in such a delicate matter, but this woman is not suitable, not suitable at all! Please, just go.

option.optiontext: You promised me a reward!
Consider it a lesson and let the man make his own decisions.

node.text: Yes, but for a suitable woman! How could you possible think of her as suitable!? Please just leave.

option.optiontext: Well, consider it a lesson and let the man make his own decisions.

node.text: How dare you?! Who do you think you are?! Get out!! Out of my home, I say!!
Hey... *hic* ...handsome... Wanna get married, hehe...? *hic*

option.optiontext: Actually, I do know of a man who's looking to get married.
Not today.

node.text: Oh... *hic* ...oh really? That sounds fun... You're... funny!

option.optiontext: Absolutely! Aaron in Timberwell is without a spouse. Maybe you should go introduce yourself.
Maybe this isn't a good idea...

node.text: You know... *hic* ...maybe I will! Woo, yeah! This girl is getting herself a husband! *hic*!

option.optiontext: Well alright then, that was easy.

node.text: Oh, how I'm sick of living in this cramped little house with my papa. I'm old enough to marry, you know. I deserve a husband who will build a mansion for me.

option.optiontext: Aaron in Timberwell is in need of a spouse. I'm sure he could build you a house.
Good luck with that.

node.text: Timberwell? But... Oh, but... Well, that's even more backwatery than Grainwater! I'm a city girl at heart, you know. I hate it when I get mud on my skirts. Tell me, is he handsome at least?

option.optiontext: Works the forge all day from what I hear, strong arms and all that.
Maybe it's not going to work out then.

node.text: I see, well... Forges are terribly dirty, I'd have to make sure he bathes every day. But maybe I could tolerate it. Oh, do you think I should?

option.optiontext: Absolutely, go for it!
Maybe it's not a good idea.

node.text: Then I shall travel to meet this Aaron immediately! Thank you for your advice, stranger.
Look at all these crabs - they're so cute with their little claws and everything! Isn't nature just wonderful?

option.optiontext: Indeed, I believe a young man in Timberwell is also very fond of nature.
I don't really care.

node.text: Oh, truly? I would very much like to meet this man! Sometimes I feel like the only thing men in Grainwater are fond of is beer.

option.optiontext: You know, I think he'd very much like to meet you. His name is Aaron, you'll find him by the forge.
He's a solitary man, maybe he doesn't want to meet you.

node.text: I shall go at once!
Oh... Well that's a shame.
Wait, stranger! I hear you had something to do with finding this wonderful woman and bringing us together.
I wanted to thank you, but... well, I don't have much to offer, but maybe you can make use of this book. It taught me everything I know about working the forge.

option.optiontext: Alright, thanks I guess.
